required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Bedside Genetic or Pharmacodynamic Testing to Prevent Periprocedural Myonecrosis During PCI (ONSIDE TEST)
clinical_study.official_title: Optimal P2Y12-receptor treatmeNt Guided by bedSIDe Genetic or Pharmacodynamic TESTing to Prevent Periprocedural Myonecrosis During Elective Percutaneous Coronary Intervention.

brief_summary.textblock: Patients undergoing percutaneous coronary intervention with a residual high platelet reactivity despite oral clopidogrel are at increased risk of ischaemic complications. The strategies to overcome the issue consist of switch to a more potent antiplatelet medications including prasugrel or ticagrelor. Economic constrains of many countries still do not allow wide reimbursement of newer antiplatelet agents. Therefore a strategy to personalise treatment according to genotype and phenotype characteristics of the patient may provide an attractive solution combining high clinical efficacy with low budget impact.

primary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of periprocedural myocardial injury within 24 h after PCI
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 24 hours after Percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PCI)
primary_outcome.description: Post-procedural troponin value increase exceeding the 99th percentile upper reference limit (URL) within 24 hours after PCI

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients having periprocedural myocardial infarction (MI)
secondary_outcome.description: Periprocedural MI is defined as a CK-MB elevation greater than 3x of the upper limit of norm (ULN) within 24 hours of elective PCI.

other_outcome.description: The level of peak troponin-I elevation during 24 hours of elective PCI

other_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with peri-procedural MI
other_outcome.description: The rate of peri-procedural MI defined as a peak troponin-I value greater than 5x the ULN within 24 hours.
BARC-defined type 3 (clinical, laboratory, and/or imaging evidence of bleeding, with healthcare provider responses) and type 5 (fatal) bleeds happening within 7 days of PCI.

other_outcome.measure: Death, MI, stent thrombosis (ST) or urgent repeat revascularization
other_outcome.description: The rate of cardiac death, myocardial infarction, definite or probable stent thrombosis or urgent repeat revascularization within 30 days of elective PCI.

arm_group.description: Rapid genotyping to select optimal P2Y12-inhibitor for PCI.
The use of platelet function testing to select the optimal P2Y12-inhibitor for PCI.
Regular approach for performing elective PCI.

intervention.description: Patients harboring CYP2C19 *2 alleles receive 60 mg prasugrel for PCI, while non-carriers receive 600 mg clopidogrel if not pretreated with clopidogrel.
intervention.other_name: Spartan rapid genotyping device to screen CYP2C19 *2 carriage in patients in the Genotyping Arm.

intervention.description: Patients having high on-treatment platelet reactivity (HPR: greater than 208 PRU) receive 60 mg prasugrel loading dose (LD), others continue clopidogrel for PCI.
intervention.other_name: VerifyNow P2Y12 assay to test the response to clopidogrel.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age 18-75
- elective PCI
Exclusion Criteria:
- acute coronary syndrome (troponin > 1 x ULN),
- administration of glycoprotein IIb/IIIa inhibitors,
- chronic total occlusion,
- lesions with extensive calcifications requiring rotational atherectomy,
- platelet count <70 000 /µl
- high bleeding risk,
- coronary bypass surgery in the previous 3 months,
- severe chronic renal failure (eGFR < 30 mL/min)
- requirement for warfarin, dabigatran, apixaban, rivaroxaban
- history of stroke or TIA,
- weight < 60 kg
- known bleeding diathesis,
- hematocrit of < 30% or >52%
- pregnancy

facility.name: 1st Department of Cardiology, Medical University of Warsaw

study_doc.doc_comment: Study design and rationale for Optimal aNtiplatelet pharmacotherapy guided by bedSIDE genetic or functional TESTing in elective percutaneous coronary intervention patients (ONSIDE TEST): a prospective, open-label, randomised parallel-group multicentre trial (NCT01930773). Kołtowski Ł, Aradi D, Huczek Z, Tomaniak M, Sibbing D, Filipiak KJ, Kochman J, Balsam P, Opolski G. Kardiol Pol. 2016;74(4):372-9. doi: 10.5603/KP.a2015.0172.

Optimal aNtiplatelet pharmacotherapy guided by bedSIDE genetic or functional TESTing in elective PCI patients: A pilot study: ONSIDE TEST pilot. Koltowski L, Tomaniak M, Aradi D, Huczek Z, Filipiak KJ, Kochman J, Gajda S, Balsam P, Opolski G. Cardiol J. 2017 Mar 10. doi: 10.5603/CJ.a2017.0026. [Epub ahead of print]
